Derivatives 11 and 12 were tested also against AChE ( Electrophorus electricus) and BuChE (equine serum), as recognised models for human cholinesterases due to their close structural resemblance
52 . For that purpose, Ellman’s colorimetric assay was used; this is an indirect test in which acetyl and butyryl thiocholine iodides are used as model substrates, which upon interaction with the enzyme release thiocholine, which in turn reacts with the chromogen reagent 5,5′-dithiobis(2-nitrobenzoic acid (DTNB) to give 2-nitro-5-mercaptobenzoate (at pH 8.0). The monitoring of the latter at 405 nm furnishes the kinetic parameters.
